poem:
**The Seat of Change**

In the quiet hum of a southern bus,  
one woman's stillness spoke volumes.  
While others moved to the tide of compliance,  
she anchored herself,  
her refusal a whisper,  
growing into a roar.  
History paused,  
caught its breath,  
and moved over—  
not just giving a seat,  
but shifting the whole world.

As one white man had to stand towards the front, the driver asked the four to get up and move towards the back of the bus. Three did; one did not – the rest is history.
